newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE cocoa ends slow session off highs.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE cocoa ends slow session off highs.

text.p: LIFFE cocoa futures closed a sluggish day off session highs.

July ended up two stg at 1,005 stg per tonne after trading in a small range most of the day. July rose one stg above Wednesday's high. But it could not garner enough strength to climb higher and started to give back gains.
Total volume stood at 7,053, with December 1997 taking the biggest chunk with 3,206 lots traded. May 1998 traded 2,107 contracts and 1,189 July contracts changed hands.
Traders said light sales came from commission houses, possibly funds. New York's inability to rise also dampened cocoa's rise.
But most trading arose from crosses. Traders said a large trade house crossed about 620 December contracts in the morning at 1,016.
In the afternoon, another firm traded 2,000 Dec/May switches, traders said. They said 1,500 were done at 20 stg and the remainder at 21.
Though traders said cocoa could probably stay rangebound for a bit longer, they said sentiment has turned more optimistic. They said July could continue to inch up toward intial resistance at 1,015.
But sales in the upper 1,020-area and higher were expected to emerge and limit gains in the near-term.
